questions.question: How do I set up a web interface using ComfyUI?
questions.answer: Clone or download the comfygen repository into the `custom_nodes` directory within ComfyUI. Then run the ComfyUI server by executing `run_nvidia_gpu.bat` or `run_cpu.bat`. Enable Dev Mode Options, generate a workflow JSON, replace the base workflow JSON with your own, and access the web interface at `<comfy_address>:<comfy_port>/<repository_name>`.
questions.subject: ComfyUI

questions.question: What files should I replace to use my custom workflow in ComfyUI?
questions.answer: Replace the `web/js/base_workflow.json` file with your generated JSON workflow file to use your customized workflow in ComfyUI.
questions.subject: ComfyUI

questions.question: How do I enable Dev Mode Options in ComfyUI?
questions.answer: Click on 'Settings' in the ComfyUI interface to enable Dev Mode Options.
questions.subject: ComfyUI

questions.question: What is the default workflow replacement process in ComfyUI?
questions.answer: In Dev Mode, click 'Save (API Format)' to create a JSON for your workflow. Then replace the `web/js/base_workflow.json` file with your JSON to use your workflow.
questions.subject: ComfyUI

questions.question: How do I access the web interface for ComfyUI?
questions.answer: Open your web browser and navigate to `http://<comfy_address>:<comfy_port>/<repository_name>` (for example, `http://127.0.0.1:8188/comfygen`) to access the ComfyUI web interface.
questions.subject: ComfyUI
